tit.e: Somanouchi-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a tumulus cluster in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)
Somanouchi-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a tumulus cluster in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 杣之内古墳群（そまのうちこふんぐん）は、奈良県天理市にある古墳群。
sen.e: Somanouchi burial mounds area burial mounds in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Somanouchi-kofun Tumulus Cluster is a tumulus cluster in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Somanouchi-kofun Tumulus Cluster is a tumulus cluster in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 石上神宮の南、山辺の道沿いに分布する。
sen.e: The mounds are distributed in south of Isonokami-jingu Shrine along the load neighborhood of a mountain.
The mounds are distributed in south of Isonokami-jingu Shrine along the load neighborhood of a mountain.
The mounds are distributed in south of Isonokami-jingu Shrine along the load neighborhood of a mountain.

sen.j: 天理市の杣之内町、勾田町、乙木町に点在する古墳群。
sen.e: The burial mounds dot Somanouchi-cho, Magata-cho, and Otogi-cho in Tenri City.
The tumulus cluster dot Somanouchi-cho, Magata-cho, and Otogi-cho in Tenri City.
The tumulus cluster dot Somanouchi-cho, Magata-cho, and Otogi-cho in Tenri City.

sen.j: 布留川の南に位置し、東から延びた丘陵を利用して古墳がつくられている。
sen.e: They are located in south of Furukawa River and constructed using the hill extending from east.
They are located in the south of the Furu-kawa River and constructed using the hill extending from east.
They are located in the south of the Furu-kawa River and constructed using the hill extending from east.

sen.j: 布留遺跡をはさんだ北には石上・豊田古墳群が、南には大和古墳群の北枝群である萱生古墳群が所在する。
sen.e: There is Ishikami Toyota burial mounds on the north across the Furu Site, and Kayo burial mounds, which is the north branch group of Oyamato tomb group, is on the south across the Furu Site.
sen.cmt: 「北枝群」の定訳が不明でしたので、"north branch group"としました。
sen.e: There is Ishikami Toyota-kofun Tumulus Cluster on the north across the Furu Site, and Kayo-kofun Tumulus Cluster, which is the north branch group of Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster, is on the south across the Furu Site.

There is Ishikami Toyota-kofun Tumulus Cluster on the north across the Furu Site, and Kayo-kofun Tumulus Cluster, which is the north branch group of Oyamato-kofun Tumulus Cluster, is on the south across the Furu Site.

sen.j: 墳丘の形が前方後円墳→巨大円墳→円墳と推移しているのが特徴である。
sen.e: The burial mounds are characterized by the change in the shape of mounds from the keyhole-shaped mound, the huge round barrow, to the round barrow.
The burial mounds are characterized by the change in the shape of mounds from the keyhole-shaped to the round barrow through the huge round barrow.
The burial mounds are characterized by the change in the shape of mounds from the keyhole-shaped to the round barrow through the huge round barrow.

sen.j: 被葬者に関しては物部氏との関連が指摘されている。
sen.e: Regarding the buried people, it is thought to have a relation to the Mononobe Clan.
Regarding the buried people, it is thought to have a relation to the Mononobe clan.
Regarding the buried people, it is thought to have a relation to the Mononobe clan.

sen.j: 西山古墳 - 古墳時代前期の築造。
sen.e: Nishiyama Tumulus - constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period.)
Nishiyama Tumulus: Constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Nishiyama Tumulus: Constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 墳丘長183メートルの日本最大の前方後方墳。
sen.e: The 183-meter-long tumuli is the largest Zenpo-koho (square front and square back) mound in Japan.
The 183-meter-long tumulus is the largest square front, square back mound in Japan.
The 183-meter-long tumulus is the largest square front, square back mound in Japan.

sen.j: 小半坊塚古墳 - 西山古墳の北約200mのところにあった前方後円墳。
sen.e: Kohanbozuka Tumulus - the keyhole-shaped mound which was located on about 200 meters north of Nishiyama Tumulus.
Kohanbozuka Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound which was located on about 200 meters north of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Kohanbozuka Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound which was located on about 200 meters north of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 全長92メートル、後円部直径52メートル、前方部を西に向けていた。
sen.e: It had a total length of 92 meters, and includes the round back part of 52 meters in diameter, and the square front part facing west.
It had a total length of 92 meters, and includes the back circular part of 52 meters in diameter, and the front square part facing west.
It had a total length of 92 meters, and includes the back circular part of 52 meters in diameter, and the front square part facing west.

sen.j: 西山古墳と同じく古墳時代前期の築造だが、第2次世界大戦中に消滅した。
sen.e: Similar to Nishiyama Tumulus, it was constructed in the early tumulus period, but has been lost during World War II.
Similar to Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus, it was constructed in the early Kofun period, but has been lost during World War II.
Similar to Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus, it was constructed in the early Kofun period, but has been lost during World War II.

sen.j: 小墓古墳 - 前方部を南西に向けた前方後円墳で、古墳時代中期の築造。
sen.e: Obaka Tumulus - the keyhole-shaped mound, which has the square front part facing southwest, and was constructed in the middle of tumulus period.
Obaka-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which has the front square part facing southwest, and was constructed in the middle of Kofun period.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Obaka-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which has the front square part facing southwest, and was constructed in the middle of Kofun period.

sen.j: 全長約80メートル、現状は高さは6メートルだが上部が削平されているため本来の高さは不明である。
sen.e: It is about 80 meters long and 6 meters high at present, however, the original height is unknown since the top of the tumulus was leveled.
It is about 80 meters long and 6 meters high at present, however, the original height is unknown since the top of the tumulus was leveled.
It is about 80 meters long and 6 meters high at present, however, the original height is unknown since the top of the tumulus was leveled.

sen.j: 1978年の発掘調査では周濠から木製埴輪が出土している。
sen.e: During the excavation research in 1978, a wooden haniwa (figure artifact) was excavated from the surrounding moats.
During the excavation research in 1978, a wooden haniwa (figure artifact) was excavated from the surrounding moats.
During the excavation research in 1978, a wooden haniwa (figure artifact) was excavated from the surrounding moats.

sen.j: 笠神山古墳 - 全長45メートルの前方後円墳で前方部を北西に向ける。
sen.e: Kasakamiyama Tumulus - the 45-meter-long keyhole-shaped mound whose square front part facing northwest.
Kasakamiyama-kofun Tumulus: A 45-meter-long keyhole-shaped mound whose front square part facing northwest.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Kasakamiyama-kofun Tumulus: A 45-meter-long keyhole-shaped mound whose front square part facing northwest.

sen.j: 古墳時代中期
sen.e: middle of tumulus period.
Middle of Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 表記、用語を変えました。
sen.e: Middle of Kofun period.

sen.j: 西乗鞍古墳 - 古墳時代後期（6世紀前半）の築造とみられる前方後円墳。
sen.e: Nishinorikura Tumulus - the keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late tumulus period (the early sixth century.)
Nishinorikura-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late Kofun period (the early sixth century.)
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Nishinorikura-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late Kofun period (the early sixth century.)

sen.j: 全長120メートル、高さ18メートルで前方部を南に向ける。
sen.e: It has the total length of 120 meters and the height of 18 meters, and includes the square front part facing the south.
It has the total length of 120 meters and the height of 18 meters, and includes the front square part facing the south.
It has the total length of 120 meters and the height of 18 meters, and includes the front square part facing the south.

sen.j: 古墳の周囲には空濠がめぐるが、発掘調査の結果、前方部の南側に幅約20メートル深さの溝が確認されており、外濠とみられている。
sen.e: The tumulus is surrounded with empty moats, and a deep moat 20 meters wide, which is seen as the outer moat, was confirmed on the south side of the square front part by the results of the research.
sen.cmt: 「幅約20メートル深さの溝」との記述ですが、「幅約20メートルの深い溝」と訳しています。
sen.e: The tumulus is surrounded with empty moats in about 20 meters depth, which is seen as the outer moat, was confirmed on the south side of the front square part by the results of the research.
The tumulus is surrounded with empty moats in about 20 meters depth, which is seen as the outer moat, was confirmed on the south side of the front square part by the results of the research.

sen.j: 東乗鞍古墳 - 古墳時代後期（6世紀中）の築造とみられる前方後円墳。
sen.e: Higashinorikura Tumulus - the keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late tumulus period (the mid-sixth century.)
Higashinorikura-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late Kofun period (the mid-sixth century).
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Higashinorikura-kofun Tumulus: A keyhole-shaped mound, which is thought that was constructed in the late Kofun period (the mid-sixth century).

sen.j: 全長約75メートル、高さ10メートルで前方部を西に向ける。
sen.e: It has the total length of 75 meters and the height of 10 meters, and includes the square front part facing the west.
It has the total length of 75 meters and the height of 10 meters, and the front square part faces the west.
It has the total length of 75 meters and the height of 10 meters, and the front square part faces the west.

sen.j: 長さ14.6メートルの南に開口した横穴式石室を有する。
sen.e: It has the 14.6-meter-long horizontal stone chamber open to the south.
It has the 14.6-meter-long horizontal stone chamber open to the south.
It has the 14.6-meter-long horizontal stone chamber open to the south.

sen.j: 塚穴山古墳 - 西山古墳のすぐ北に隣接する径64メートルの円墳で、古墳時代終末期の築造とみられている。
sen.e: Tsukaanayama Tumulus - the round barrow of 64 meters in diameter, which is located right next to Nishiyama Tumulus on the north and constructed in the end of tumulus period.
Tsukaanayama-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of 64 meters in diameter, which is located on the north of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus and constructed in the end of Kofun period.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Tsukaanayama-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of 64 meters in diameter, which is located on the north of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus and constructed in the end of Kofun period.

sen.j: 天井石は失っているものの全長17メートルの石室を有する。
sen.e: The ceiling stone has been lost, but it has the 17-meters-long stone chamber.
sen.cmt: 「天井石」は定訳不明でしたので、"ceiling stone" としました。
sen.e: Although the ceiling stone has been lost, it has the 17-meters-long stone chamber.
Although the ceiling stone has been lost, it has the 17-meters-long stone chamber.

sen.j: 羨道部分に同じ大きさの巨石ならべる方法は石舞台古墳と共通している。
sen.e: The way to place the gigantic stones of equal size on the passage part is in common with Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus.
The way to place the gigantic stones of equal size on the passage part is in common with Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus.
The way to place the gigantic stones of equal size on the passage part is in common with Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 峯塚古墳 - 西山古墳から東に約500mほどのところにある径35メートル高さ6メートル2段構築の円墳である。
sen.e: Minezuka Tumulus - the round barrow of 35 meters in diameter and 6 meters in height, which has the two stage construction and is located about 500 meters east of Nishiyama Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 「2段構築」は定訳不明でしたので、"two stage construction"としました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Minezuka-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of 35 meters in diameter and 6 meters in height, which has the two stage construction and is located about 500 meters east of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Minezuka-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of 35 meters in diameter and 6 meters in height, which has the two stage construction and is located about 500 meters east of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 墓地の下に位置するため墓山とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: The tumulus is also called Hakayama (i.e. grave mound), since it is located under the cemetery.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The tumulus is also called Hakayama (i.e. grave mound), since it is located under the cemetery.
The tumulus is also called Hakayama (i.e. grave mound), since it is located under the cemetery.

sen.j: 古墳時代終末期（6世紀末から7世紀前半）の築造で、岩屋山古墳といわれる整美な巨石を用いた横穴式石室で知られる。
sen.e: It was constructed in the end of tumulus period (from the end of sixth century to the early seventh century) and has been known of the horizontal stone chamber using beautifully arranged gigantic stones, which is called Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus.

It was constructed in the end of Kofun period (from the end of sixth century to the early seventh century) and has been known of the horizontal stone chamber using beautifully arranged gigantic stones, which is called Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus.

It was constructed in the end of Kofun period (from the end of sixth century to the early seventh century) and has been known of the horizontal stone chamber using beautifully arranged gigantic stones, which is called Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 墳丘には切石を用いた葺石がなされている。
sen.e: Fuki-ishi (a stone covering an old tomb) using kiri-ishi (cut stones) is provided for the tumulus.
Fukiishi (a stone covering an old tomb) using kiriishi (cut stones) is provided for the tumulus.
Fukiishi (a stone covering an old tomb) using kiriishi (cut stones) is provided for the tumulus.

sen.j: 保昌塚古墳 - 現状は直径約17メートルの円墳。
sen.e: Hoshozuka Tumulus - the round barrow of about 17 meters in diameter at present.
Hoshozuka-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of about 17 meters in diameter at present.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Hoshozuka-kofun Tumulus: A round barrow of about 17 meters in diameter at present.

sen.j: 激しく削平されており本来の形や大きさは不明である。
sen.e: It has been severely leveled and the original shape and size are unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It has been severely leveled and the original shape and size are unknown.
It has been severely leveled and the original shape and size are unknown.

sen.j: 直径25メートルから35メートルの円墳との調査結果もある。
sen.e: However, there is a research result showing that the tumulus was the round barrow of 25 to 35 meters in diameter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, there is a research result showing that the tumulus was the round barrow of 25 to 35 meters in diameter.
However, there is a research result showing that the tumulus was the round barrow of 25 to 35 meters in diameter.
